<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/common/ErrorDetailsV2.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/common/ErrorDetailsV2.xsd"> <!--Date Author Ver Change Rel SR#--> <!--01/29/2008 Chandra Ganne 1.3 Upd errorProgramId len to 255 (CS#305087) R10 E3308.008--> <xs:complexType name="ProviderErrorType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure to hold EAI or back-office detail error information. It is not intended for programmatic decisions unless specific API documentation allows, but to facilitate troubleshooting by logging verbose error conditions.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="providerErrorCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Numeric encoding of the error. Intended to be consumed programatically.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="tns:ProviderErrorCodeType"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="providerErrorText" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Human-readable description of the error.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="tns:ProviderErrorTextType"> <xs:maxLength value="1024"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="errorSystem" type="tns:ErrorSystemType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="errorTransactionId" type="tns:ErrorTransactionIdType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="errorProgramId" type="tns:ErrorProgramIdType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="fieldInError" type="tns:FieldInErrorType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="errorDetailItem" type="tns:ErrorDetailsType"/> <xs:complexType name="ErrorDetailsType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Defines the customization of the SOAP 1.1 Fault details element.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="providerError" type="tns:ProviderErrorType" maxOccurs="1000"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ProviderErrorCodeType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ProviderErrorTextType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="1024"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ErrorProgramIdType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ErrorTransactionIdType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FieldInErrorType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ErrorSystemType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/common/header/WSMessageHeader/v2" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="2.10" xmlns="http://integration.sprint.com/common/header/WSMessageHeader/v2" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Change Rel SR#--> <!--03/08/09 Steve Heichelheim Add securityMessageHeader structure 2.0 E4435--> <!--08/24/2009 Steve Heichelheim 2.1 added basicCredentialInfo structure OCT 09 PJ001807--> <!--09/24/2009 Dweepant Bakshi 2.1 removed minlengths from fields in trackingMessageHeader structure OCT 09 CS#339568--> <!--09/24/2009 Dweepant Bakshi 2.2 removed restriction in the derivedBy property of applicationId and consumerId SC#8984140 CS#380890--> <!--05/21/2010 Suneel Pathipati password is changed to optional under sdcLoginCredentials GBL10.3 SD# 9053746--> <!--08/31/2011 Steve Heichelheim 2.4 added ssn, federalTaxId, securityAnswer to the securityMessageHeader MID11.4 PJ006382--> <!--09/23/2013 Dweepant Bakshi 2.5 securityAnswer to the securityMessageHeader GBL13.3 PJ008896--> <!--12/11/2013 Ishita Biswas 2.6 Added callingApplicationInfo structure MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--12/16/2013 Ishita Biswas 2.7 Removed timestamp & messageId from callingApplicationInfo MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--02/21/2014 Ishita Biswas 2.8 Removed enumeration in the simpleType definition of orderId MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--02/21/2014 Ishita Biswas 2.9 Removed callingApplication.messageType MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--02/26/2014 Ishita Biswas 2.9 Removed callingApplication.brandType MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--03/03/2014 Tracy Turner 2.10 Changed max field lengths for 3 callingApplication fields: storeId from 7 to 50, pin from 4 to 20, and orderId from 24 to 28 MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--03/04/2014 Adon Powell 2.10 standardized MID14.2.1 PJ007526 Phase2--> <!--01/11/2016 Dweepant Bakshi 3.0 Added doorId and salesForceId GBL16.1.0 PJ020449 Prepaid IB CR002--> <!----> <xs:element name="wsMessageHeader" type="WsMessageHeaderType"/> <!----> <xs:complexType name="BasicCredentialInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="id"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Can be used to specify a user or system id when communicating with an external system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="LoginUserIdentifier"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="password"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Can be used to specify a user or system password when communicating with an external system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="PasswordString"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="LoginType"> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:element name="pin" type="PasswordPin" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>account pin</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sdcLoginCredentials" type="SdcLoginCredentialsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>sdc stands for Sprint.com</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SdcLoginCredentialsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userId" type="LoginUserIdentifier"/> <xs:element name="password" type="PasswordString" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SecurityMessageHeaderType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:element name="sdcLoginCredentials" type="SdcLoginCredentialsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>sdc stands for Sprint.com</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="basicCredentialInfo" type="BasicCredentialInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Can be used to provide authentication creditentials when communicating with an external system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pin" type="PasswordPin" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>account pin</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="taxIdCredentials" type="TaxIdCredentialsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="securityAnswer" type="SecurityAnswerType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>account security answer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="corpId" type="CorporationIdentifier" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>corporation Id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="TrackingMessageHeaderType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="applicationId" type="ApplicationIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ID of the application within the corporate entity from which this message originated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="applicationUserId" type="ApplicationUserId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ID of the user of the application within the corporate entity from which the message originated</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="consumerId" type="ApplicationIdentifier" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ID of the corporate entity or busines unit from which this message originated (e.g. Corporation code or Portal applId).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="messageId" type="MessageIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A unique identifier for this message, to enable tracking, reporting, and correlation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversationId" type="ConversationIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each message is part of a conversation between two or more systems in a given session. The Conversation ID is a UID, which can be used to group all messages exchanged within a session. This is field is primarily used for tracking, reporting, root-cause-analysis, and non-repudiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="timeToLive" type="SecondsToLiveQuantityType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies how long in seconds this message is relevant after the message timestamp. The calling application can time-out after 'timeToLive' seconds.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="replyCompletionCode" type="ReplyCompletionCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>the providerâ€™s declaration of its success or failure in processing the submitted request; 0 = Successful completion, 4 = Successful completion, but with a warning as to some unusual circumstance, 8 = Error, request was not processed successfully, 12 = Severe error, represents a failure that could indicate a major system irregularity</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="messageDateTimeStamp" type="CreationDateTime"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The dateTimeStamp of when the message was created. This can be used for tracking and reporting and also by the consuming application to determine if the message is stale. Timestamp should be in GMT TZ when the caller is unable to format with timezone and offset. e.g. 2007-10-01T14:20:33 is acceptable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="WsMessageHeaderType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="trackingMessageHeader" type="TrackingMessageHeaderType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>SOAP header interface to carry data elements that are relevant to tracking, reporting, troubleshooting, and non-repudiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="securityMessageHeader" type="SecurityMessageHeaderType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Carrries data elements for security validation. The API access may be based on first validating the security credentials</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="callingApplicationInfo" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Calling application or vendor info. This is required for order validation (OVM) calls</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="pin" type="PersonalIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Combination of vendorCode and pin is used to differentiate the calling system (channel).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="vendorCode" type="VendorCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Combination of vendorCode and pin is used to differentiate the calling system (channel).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subVendorCode" minOccurs="0"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="vendorUsername" minOccurs="0"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="vendorPassword" minOccurs="0"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="orderId" type="ActivationOrderIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activation Order Identifier uniquely identifies an Activation Order.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="returnUrl" type="xs:anyURI" minOccurs="0"> <!--The URL to which the response for this request should be sent. This is not needed for port eligibility requests.--> </xs:element> <xs:element name="resendNumber" type="xs:nonNegativeInteger" minOccurs="0"> <!--Number of times this message has been attempted. This is not needed for port eligibility requests.--> </xs:element> <xs:element name="storeId" type="RetailStoreIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies store for reporting purposes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="associateId" type="AssociateIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies associate for reporting purposes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="doorId" type="DealerDoorIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>DOOR ID for the dealer. indirect channel has many dealers and each dealer location is a dealer door_id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="salesForceId" type="LoginUserIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides Door information for Prepaid orders</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> <xs:anyAttribute namespace="##any" processContents="lax"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This is used by AXIS. Do not delete this field or AXIS generated code will have issues.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:anyAttribute> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="TaxIdCredentialsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:element name="ssn" type="SocialSecurityNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>social security number</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="federalTaxId" type="FederalEmployerIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>federal tax id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ApplicationIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Application Identifier uniquely identifies an Application</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ApplicationUserId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Application User Identifier uniquely identifies the PARTY invoking the service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CorporationIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Corporation Identifer uniquely identifies a corporate entity.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="16"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CreationDateTime"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creation Data Time represents a calendar Month, Day,Year, Hour, Minute, Second and Fraction Of A Second an event was created.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LoginUserIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Login User Identifier holds the system login userid assigned to a PARTY.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="33"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MessageIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Message Identifier uniquely identifies a message.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PasswordPin"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PasswordString"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Password String holds the string characters a PARTy designated as a Password into a system or Customer Account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ReplyCompletionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reply Completion Code holds the the provider's declaration of the Service's success or failure in processing the submitted request.
Values: 0 = Successful completion, 4 = Successful completion, but with a warning as to some unusual circumstance, 8 = Error, request was not processed successfully, 12 = Severe error, represents a failure that could indicate a major system irregularity</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:long"/> </xs:simpleType> <!----> <!--New Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ConversationIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversation Identifier is a UID, which can be used to group all messages exchanged within a session. This is field is primarily used for tracking, reporting, root-cause-analysis, and non-repudiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DealerDoorIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Dealer Door Identifier is a way to designate a dealer location in an indirect channel. An indirect channel has many dealers and each dealer location is assigned a dealer door identifier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LoginUserIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Login User Identifier holds the system login userid assigned to a PARTY.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="50"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SecondsToLiveQuantityType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Seconds To Live Quantity specifies how long in seconds this message is relevant after the message timestamp. The calling application can time-out after 'timeToLive' seconds.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SecurityAnswerType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Security Answer holds the answer to the Security Question identified by Security Question Identifier. This value must be supplied by the system user in response to the Security Question before they are allowed to proceed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="16"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SocialSecurityNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Social Security number (SSN) is a 9-digit number issued to citizens, permanent residents, and temporary (working) residents under section 205(c)(2) of the Social Security Act, codified as 42 U.S.C.Â§ 405(c)(2). The number is issued to an individual by the Social Security Administration, an agency of the U.S. Federal Government. Its primary purpose is to track individuals for taxation purposes. In recent years the SSN has become a de facto national identification number.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="4"/> <xs:maxLength value="9"/> <xs:pattern value="\d{4}|\d{9}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FederalEmployerIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Federal Employer Identification Number or (FEIN) is the corporate equivalent to a Social Security Number, although it is issued to anyone, including individuals, who has to pay withholding taxes on employees.
The FEIN is a unique nine-digit number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to business entities operating in the United States for the purposes of identification. When the number is used for identification rather than employment tax reporting, it is usually referred to as a TIN, and when used for the purposes of reporting employment taxes, it is usually referred to as an EIN.
Similar in purpose to the Social Security Number assigned to individuals, EINs are used by employers, sole proprietors, corporations, partnerships, non-profit organizations, trusts and estates, government agencies, certain individuals and other business entities.
The IRS uses this number to identify taxpayers that are required to file various business tax returns. Individuals who are employers may choose to either obtain an EIN or use their Social Security Number for the purpose of reporting taxes withheld on behalf of their employees. Contrary to some misconceptions, credit bureaus and credit issuers can tell the difference between SSN and EIN Numbers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="4"/> <xs:maxLength value="9"/> <xs:pattern value="\d{4}|\d{9}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PersonalIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Personal Identification Number (PIN) is a secret numeric password shared between a user and a system that can be used to authenticate the user to the system. Typically, the user is required to provide a non-confidential user identifier or token (such as a banking card) and a confidential PIN to gain access to the system. Upon receiving the User ID and PIN, the system looks up the PIN based upon the User ID and compares the looked-up PIN with the received PIN. The user is granted access only when the number entered matches with the number stored in the system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="VendorCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Vendor Code in combination with the PIN uniquely differentiates the system (channel) calling Order Verification Management (Best Buy, Walmart, RMS, boostmobile, SOTS, OARâ€™s, BSPs, Telespree, etc). Each partner has its own unique vendor code and pin combination.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="2"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActivationOrderIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activation Order Identifier uniquely identifies an Activation Order.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="28"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RetailStoreIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retail Store Identifer is the store ID passed from the retailer front-end</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="50"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AssociateIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Associate Identifier is the Retail Store Associate Identifier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/addForeignDevice/v1/addForeignDevice.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.1" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/addForeignDevice/v1/addForeignDevice.xsd" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Version Description Rel SR#--> <!--03/13/2015 Lais Gasparini 1.0 Initial Revision GBL15.2.0 PJ009752 CR41 Epic 306--> <!--03/17/2015 Steve Heichelheim 1.0 Standardized GBL15.2.0 PJ009752 CR41--> <!--05/18/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Added skuType, brandCode to the request and modelNumber to the response. GBL15.2.0 PJ009752 CR41 Epic 306--> <!----> <xs:element name="addForeignDevice" type="tns:AddForeignDeviceRequestType"/> <xs:element name="addForeignDeviceResponse" type="tns:AddForeignDeviceResponseType"/> <!----> <xs:complexType name="AddForeignDeviceRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AddForeignDeviceResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format. Echoed back from the request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. Echoed back from the request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="availableReasonCode" type="tns:SerialNumberAvailabilityStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NMS availability reason codes. - 226: Device exists in Sprint Inventory and is compatible with Sprint. - 214: Device exists and is compatible with Sprint. FED updated. - 213: Device added/updated successfully to Sprint Inventory.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="availableReasonDescription" type="tns:SerialNumberAvailabilityStatusDescriptionType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NMS availability reason. Valid values: - SUCCESS_DEVICE_EXISTS: returned with availableReasonCode 226. - SUCCESS_DEVICE_EXISTS_FED_UPDATED: is returned with availableReasonCode 214 - SUCCESS_DEVICE_ADDED: returned with availableReasonCode 213</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelNumber" type="tns:ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Equipment Model Number.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceDetailInfo" type="tns:DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="partNumber" type="tns:StockKeepingUnitType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Part number associated with the manufacturer and Sprint SKU.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="brandCode" type="tns:BrandCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Valid values: BST - Boost SPP â€“ Sprint Prepaid VMU â€“ Virgin Mobile ASW â€“ Assurance Wireless</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="skuType" type="tns:DeviceCategoryNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device type: Tablet, handset, etc.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if esnMeidDec is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if esnMeidHex is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="BrandCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Brand Code indicates which brand the subscriber belongs to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceCategoryNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Category Name is a common name for the category of the deivce. Valid Values Include: handset, netbook, data card, tablet, mifi/overdrive...</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SerialNumberAvailabilityStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Serial Number Availability Status Code indicates the status of a serial number's availability. Example Values: 226 - Device exists in Sprint Inventory and is compatible with Sprint 214 - Device exists and is compatible with Sprint. FED updated 213 - Device added/updated successfully to Sprint Inventory</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SerialNumberAvailabilityStatusDescriptionType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Serial Number Availability Status Description is text describing the status of a serial number's availability. Example Values: 226 - SUCCESS_DEVICE_EXISTS - Device exists in Sprint Inventory and is compatible with Sprint 214 - SUCCESS_DEVICE_EXISTS_FED_UPDATED - Device exists and is compatible with Sprint. FED updated 213 - SUCCESS_DEVICE_ADDED - Device added/updated successfully to Sprint Inventory</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="80"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="StockKeepingUnitType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Stock Keeping Unit represents the Sprint Inventory Stock Keeping Unit (SKU). Stock Keeping Unit identifies a group of PRODUCT instances. It could identify a handset Model and Model Number, a Kit or an accessory. Previously length = 18.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/authenticateDeviceToken/v1/authenticateDeviceToken.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/authenticateDeviceToken/v1/authenticateDeviceToken.xsd"> <!--Date Changed By Version Change Description Release Project Epic--> <!--04/07/2016 Natalia Silva 1.0 Initial version MID16.2.6 PJ020353 492--> <!--04/14/2016 Steve Heichelheim 1.0 Standardize MID16.2.6 PJ020353 492--> <!----> <xs:element name="authenticateDeviceToken" type="tns:AuthenticateDeviceTokenType"/> <xs:element name="authenticateDeviceTokenResponse" type="tns:AuthenticateTokenResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="AuthenticateDeviceTokenType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing the device related information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AuthenticateTokenResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The IMSI of the LTE capable device for both embedded and removable UICC. The device LTE International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device LTE International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceToken" type="tns:DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>WebSheet token send by the device to DSA platform to be authenticated to retrieve or update the Location Information or service management for the device. Encoded URL service management/address token provided by DEG.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="activityType" type="tns:TransactionTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>URL activity being carried out. Valid values: â€¢ authorization</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Token Key Identifier is a unique idenifier assigned to a device and used for authentication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="TransactionTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction Type Code identifies the functionality of the transaction. Examples: Create, Read, Update or Delete (CRUD) (other functionalities are also acceptable)</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Type Code differentiates the various categories or subtypes of an Object.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Removed the enumeration from credentialType GBL14.2 PJ012352 CS#677952--> <!--09/03/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.2 Updated to match the NMS interface GBL14.3.0 PJ012352 WC2--> userName/IMS_PUBLIC_ID (IMPU) assigned to the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceName" type="tns:DeviceNickNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device friendly name.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ManageDeviceCredentialsResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="termsStatus" type="tns:AssentFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The 911 consent flag assigned to the device. Valid values include: â€¢ 0 â€“ Not approved â€¢ 1 â€“ Approved</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="addressStatus" type="tns:AssentFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The registered Location address flag assigned to the device. Valid values include: â€¢ 0 â€“ Not registered â€¢ 1 â€“ Registered</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> <!--New Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="AssentFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Assent Flag indicates if the customer has agreed to or approved of a specific condition.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceNickNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Nick Name is a friendly, easy to remember name for a particular device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="50"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Type Code references or identifies a type of device. valid values: P - Primary, C - Companion</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is the value of a electronic serial number (ESN) OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID). This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="64"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SipUserNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>User Name is an identifier of the identity associated with a party role which is the public part of a paired identity assertion. User Name consists of all of the characters preceding the @ sign in a URL identifying a member of the specified Domain.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/manageDeviceLock/v1/manageDeviceLock.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/manageDeviceLock/v1/manageDeviceLock.xsd"> <!--Date Author Version Change Rel SR#--> <!--06/20/2012 Steve Heichelheim 1.0 Initial Version - Added MVM standards and simple types GBL12.2 PJ005782--> <!--08/24/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Added support to Domestic & International unlocking GBL14.3.0 PJ012278 WC2--> <!----> <xs:element name="manageDeviceLock" type="tns:ManageDeviceLockRequestType"/> <xs:element name="manageDeviceLockResponse" type="tns:ManageDeviceLockResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="ManageDeviceLockRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="info" type="tns:SearchCriteriaType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing the Subscriber/Device Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="actionCode" type="tns:LockActionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies if the request is for Lock or Unlocking of the SIM or UICC. â€¢ LOCK â€“ Relocking the device (State 0) â€¢ UNLOCK â€“ Unlocking International only (State 1) â€¢ DIUNLOCK â€“ Domestic and International unlocking (State 2) DIUNLOCK requests must be submitted with a deviceSerialNumber, request by MDNs are rejected.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unlockLockReason" type="tns:UnlockReasonDescriptionType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The reason for the unlock request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="overrideCode" type="tns:UnlockOverrideTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>O - Override 90 day rule A - Override All Validations D - Override deviceActiveDays rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="resellerPartnerId" type="tns:ResellerPartnerIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reseller Partner Id or BAN of the MVNO subscriber requesting the lock/unlock. Required for Ensemble Wholesale subscribers - ENW</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="carrierId" type="tns:CarrierIdentificationCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Carrier Id for a CCA (Competitive Carrier Association) carrier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ManageDeviceLockResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="accountInfo" type="tns:AccountInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing information about the subscriber requesting the device lock/unlock</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing device information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="responseList" type="tns:ResponseListType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of responseInfo structures</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AccountInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ban" type="tns:BillingAccountNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Number uniquely identifies an instance of Billing Account used to accrue charges for invoicing. Will only be returned for retail subscribers</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriberId" type="tns:SubscriberIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscriber Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="imsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) / Mobile Station Identifier MSID</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceSerialNumber" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number The ESN/MEID in decimal format will be returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:ElectronicSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ESN/MEID in Hexadecimal format</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serialType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Serial Type â€“ Indicates the type of the Equipment ID. Values: E â€“ ESN/MEID A â€“macId I â€“ IMEI M â€“ MSN S - SIM U - LTE Removable UICC</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="itemId" type="tns:ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Item Identifier, which uniquely identifies a device model</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="itemDescription" type="tns:ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Long description of the item. For phones, the model name (display name, ie "SANYO SCP2700 PNK SNG")</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier of the LTE removable UICC</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ResponseInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:ExceptionConditionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Code indicating whether transaction is completed successfully</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="message" type="tns:ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Message indicating whether transaction is completed successfully</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ResponseListType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="responseInfo" type="tns:ResponseInfoType" maxOccurs="100"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing response code and message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SearchCriteriaType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number of the subscriber. Supports relocking (LOCK) and International unlocking (UNLOCK)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceSerialNumber" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/MEID in hex or decimal format Supports relocking (LOCK) and Domestic/International unlocking (DIUUNLOCK)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="BillingAccountNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Number uniquely identifies an instance of Billing Account used to accrue charges for invoicing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="9"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CarrierIdentificationCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Carrier Identification Code identifies an Interexchange Carrier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confrim Msg Text is a string with a confirmation message returned from the called API.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="250"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Type Code designates a device type: IMEI(I), MSN(M), SIM(S), Kit (K), or ESN (E) for CDMA platform. Valid values: I - IMEI M - MSN S - SIM K - Kit E - ESN A - Airave (macId)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ElectronicSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ExceptionConditionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exception Condition Code is the providerâ€™s declaration of its success or failure in processing the submitted request.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method of identifying telephone trunks in the public network of North America, called World Numbering Zone 1 by the ITU-T. the Plan has 3 ways of identifying phone numbers in North America -- a 3-digit area code, a 3-digit exchange or central office code, and 4-digit subscriber code.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LockActionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Lock Action Code designates the action associated to the lock or unlock of the device. Valid Values: LOCK, UNLOCK</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> <xs:enumeration value="LOCK"/> <xs:enumeration value="UNLOCK"/> <xs:enumeration value="DIUNLOCK"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ResellerPartnerIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reseller Partner Identifier is a unique identifier of a reseller partner.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriberIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscriber Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies a subscriber.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a unique identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UnlockOverrideTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unlock Override Type Code designates the type of override of the unlock of the device. Valid Values: O - Override 90 day rule, A - Override All Validations</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UnlockReasonDescriptionType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unlock Reason Description is the textual description of the reason for the unlock of the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="512"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/manageDeviceToken/v2/manageDeviceTokenV2.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/manageDeviceToken/v2/manageDeviceTokenV2.xsd"> <!--Date Author Version Change Rel SR#--> <!--08/28/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.0 Initial version. GBL14.3.0 PJ012352 WC2--> <!--04/24/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Changed DeviceSerialNumberType (element deviceId) maxLen restriction 20 to 64--> <!--11/18/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.2 Added imei to the request MID16.1.0 PJ020950 â€“ Epic 617--> <!--01/06/2016 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.3 Changed uiccImsi to optional for serviceName='HANDOFF' MID16.1.0 PJ020950 - Epci 617 ALM#1061566--> <!----> <xs:element name="manageDeviceTokenV2" type="tns:ManageDeviceTokenV2RequestType"/> <xs:element name="manageDeviceTokenV2Response" type="tns:ManageDeviceTokenV2ResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="ManageDeviceTokenV2RequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing the Subscriber/Device Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ManageDeviceTokenV2ResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="message" type="tns:ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator of success</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device LTE International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number The ESN/MEID in decimal format will be returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="imei" type="tns:InternationalMobileStationEquipmentIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Equipment Identity. Same as the Sprint 14-character MEID Hex with the 15th check digit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="serviceName" type="tns:ServiceCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The notification name for the service/application (Token type) Valid values: VOWIFI, CAMBIO, HANDOFF</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceToken" type="tns:DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device token required by the Apple Push Notification Service (APNS)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confrim Msg Text is a string with a confirmation message returned from the called API.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="99"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="64"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Token Key Identifier is a unique idenifier assigned to a device and used for authentication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileStationEquipmentIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier (IMEI) identifies a wireless telecommunications term. An equipment identification number, similar to a serial number, used to identify a mobile station</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Service Code identifies a service. This includes typess of ProductIds that uniquely identifies a price plan or one of the services in that price plan.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

Added MVM standards and simple types. GBL13.3 PJ008190--> <!--08/27/2013 Priscilla Carvalho 1.1 CS#623488 - Changed the field name from esnMeid to deviceSerialNumber in the response.
