If the action is recovery (V) and the resource type is M, it is required.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="password" type="tns:PasswordType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Password of the owner where the network is private or shared with a password.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="VoicemailPageInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="voicemailPageType" type="tns:PagerTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>VM Page type. Valid values are: 21 - Generic 1800 ETE 22 - Direct Pager 23 - Sky Pager</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="voicemailPageNo" type="tns:PagerNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>VM Page Number</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="voicemailPagePin" type="tns:PagerPersonalIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>VM Page PIN</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="WorldInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="worldMdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>World MDN</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="AllocationMethodCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Allocation Method Code identifies the method used to allocate resources under a Feature. Allocation Method Code is required for all resource types except IMSI. Values: R => Random P => Pairing S => Specific.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="R"/> <xs:enumeration value="S"/> <xs:enumeration value="P"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AlternatePhoneNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Alternate Phone Number holds the telephone number given by a Party as the phone number that should be used to as an alternate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ApprovalFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Approval Flag is a boolean indicator of whether the approval will occur. Valid Values: true - the approval will occur, false - the approval will not occur</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>alias: URI</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ContractChangeReasonCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contract Change Reason Code documents the reason the Contract changed. Valid Values: EQU â€“ Equipment Update, PPD - Standard, NCC - No contract change...</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> <xs:enumeration value="EQP"/> <xs:enumeration value="EQU"/> <xs:enumeration value="PPD"/> <xs:enumeration value="COR"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ContractStartDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contract Start Date is the first date on which a contract is effective.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ContractTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contract Type Code categorizes contracts into: Upgrades, Replacements, New Equipment Purchases or New Rate Plan Contracts.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="A"/> <xs:enumeration value="B"/> <xs:enumeration value="C"/> <xs:enumeration value="D"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DealerIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Dealer Identifier uniquely identifies the dealer who interacted with the customer on behalf of the enterprise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FeatureAssignmentEffectiveThruDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Feature Assingment Effective Thru Date holds the last calendar day the Feature assignment to the Service Agreement Line Item is in effect. After this date teh Feature assignment is invalid.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FeatureCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Feature Code uniquely identifies the feature being granted in this service feature</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FleetIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Fleet Identifier is the second element of the DirectConnect UFMI number. The format of the UFMI number is: Urban User Id * Fleet Id * Member Id. Example 164*100*3441.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="7"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="HighPerformancePushToTalkIdentifierStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>High Performance Push To Talk Identifier (HPPTTID) is the identifier of a Subscription utilizing the QChat Push-To-Talk techniology. HPPTTID is constructed in the username@domain URI format. The username will be a MDN or UFMI based number.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="40"/> <xs:minLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="HighPerformancePushToTalkResourceTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>High Performance Push To Talk Resource Type Code identifies the type of High Performance Push To Talk (HPPTT) resource. C => Identifies the resource as a CDMA UFMI-based Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resource. P => Identifies the resource as a PTN -basedSession Initiation Protocol (SIP) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resource.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="C"/> <xs:enumeration value="P"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternetProtocolAddressCommonPoolFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internet Protocol Address Common Pool Indicator designates the pool the Intern Protocol Address will be allocated from. Valid Values: true - The Internet Protocol Address will be allocated from the common pool if one is not available in the Billing Account pool (Default). false - The Internet Protocol Address will be allocated from the Billing Account pool only.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternetProtocolAddressPairType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internet Protocol Address Pair holds a pair of IP Addresses used in Packet Data Switching.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="31"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternetProtocolAddressPoolIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internet Protocol Address Pool Identifier uniqely identifies an IP address pool.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternetProtocolAddressStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internet Protocol Address is the numerical address by which a location in the Internet is identified. Computers on the Internet use IP addresses to route traffic and establish connections among themselves.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternetProtocolAddressTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internet Protocol Address type code designates a type for an internet protocol adderss (usually to distinguish IPv4 from IPv6 addresses).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LastUpdateDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Last Update Date Time is the date and time of the last update to an object. Last Update Date Time is used in conjunction with the Last Update Numeric Stamp to uniquely identify a specific update iteration. Typically Last Update Date Time and Last Update Numeric Stamp would be used in a psuedo-conversational approach to updates. A record is read into local storage and the lock on the source record is released. When the updated record is written back to the database where the source Record ID equals the Update Record ID, Source Last Update Date Time equals the original Update Last Update Date Time and Source Last Update Numeric Stamp equals the original Update Last Update Numeric Stamp.Both Last UPdate Date Time and Last Update Numeric Stamp are incremented in the update.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LastUpdateNumericStampType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Last Update Numeric Stamp is used in conjunction with the Last Update Date Time to uniquely identify a specific update iteration.
Typically Last Update Date Time and Last Update Numeric Stamp would be used in a psuedo-conversational approach to updates. A record is read into local storage and the lock on the source record is released. When the updated record is written back to the database where the source Record ID equals the Update Record ID, Source Last Update Date Time equals the original Update Last Update Date Time and Source Last Update Numeric Stamp equals the original Update Last Update Numeric Stamp.
Both Last UPdate Date Time and Last Update Numeric Stamp are incremented in the update.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ManufacturerPartyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manufacturer Party Identifier holds a value that uniquely identifies the Manufacturer of the specified PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MasterSubsidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Master Subsidy Lock (MSL) is used for programming the handset when the one-time subsidy lock code fails due to error, or when the phone needs to be reprogrammed for any reason.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MdnReservationIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>MDN Reservation Identifier identifies the reservation of one or more MDN in NMS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MemberIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Member Identifier is the third element of the DirectConnect UFMI number. The format of the UFMI number is: Urban User Id * Fleet Id * Member Id. Example 164*100*3441.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="7"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberAssignmentFromDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number Assignment From Date holds the first calendar day the Mobile Directory Number was assigned to the specified wireless device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number (MDN) is the actual phone number one would dial to reach a specific mobile phone.
Prior to Wireless Number Portability, MDN was the same number as the Mobile Identification Number (MIN) for many mobile phones. But now that MDNs can be ported (moved) to other carriers, MDN and MIN will be different for ported numbers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileStationIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identity (MSID) is the number that is associated with the home service provider and the wireless phone number. This is reprogrammed when the user changes home service providers.
MSID is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NaiUserNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NAI User Name is the user name portion of the Network Access Identifer (NAI) that comes before the @ sign.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NetworkAccessIdentifierAllocationFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Network Access Identifier (NAI) Allocation Flag indicates whether the user wants to allocate a NAI. Valid Values: true - the user wants to allocate a NAI, false - the user does not want to allocate a NAI</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>alias: URI</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NetworkAccessIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Network Access Identifier holds the concatenation of the a user name and domain.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>alias: URI</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="64"/> <xs:pattern value=".+@.+\..+"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NpaNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Numbering Plan Area (NPA) Number is one of the geographical divisions of the United States, Canada, Bermuda, the Caribbean, Northwestern Mexico, Alaska, Hawaii, within which no two telephones will have the same seven-digit telephone number. (An NPA is represented by an Area Code.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberOfContractMonthsType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number Of Contract Months is the number of months the Customer must commit to to receive Rate plans, Rebates, Discount, etc. under a contract.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:unsignedByte"> <xs:maxInclusive value="99"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberGroupType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number Group (NGP) is identified as CSA by the Ensemble billing system and groups ranges for a number of resources such as IPs, IMSIs, NPANXXs, and UFs . This grouping represents a geographical zone that includes specific ranges.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberLocationCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number Location Code identifies a pool of Mobile Directory Numbers (MDNs) to which the MDN is assigned. This pool can be used by one or more store locations.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NxxNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Network Numbering Exchange (NXX) Number represents the first three digits of the 7 digit phone number that identifies the specific telephone company central office which serves that number. These digits are referred to as the NXX where N can be any number from 2 to 9 and X can be any number. (NNX once upon a time was used to identify the local central office exchange. Now NNX has been changed to NXX, which allows local central offices to have numbers which look like area codes.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OneTimeChargeWaivedReasonCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Time Charge (OTC)Waived Reason Code is the code that represents why certain adjustment charges were waived.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OneTimeKeySubsidyLockType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Time Key Subsidy Lock (OTKSL) is a six-digit code used by CDMA phones as an activation code. It is used to activate a brand new phone onto wireless service, and it works only one time. This code makes it possible for a consumer to purchase the phone anywhere, call up the provider's toll-free number, and then activate the wireless phone from the directions given by the representative on the other end of the line. After the initial programming, the code is no longer valid, and the only way to program the phone is via the MSL (master subsidy lock).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OrderIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Order Identifier uniquely identifies an order.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="9"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OrderSubLineItemNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Order Sub Line Item Number uniquely identifies an instance of Sub Line Item within the scope of an ORDER.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PagerNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pager Number is the telephone number to contact a pager.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PagerPersonalIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pager Personal Identification Number(PIN)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="7"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PagerTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pager Type Code identifies the type Pager.Valid values are:21 - Generic 1800 ETE22 - Direct Pager23 - Sky Pager</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="2"/> <xs:enumeration value="21"/> <xs:enumeration value="22"/> <xs:enumeration value="23"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ParameterValueType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Parameter Value designates the actual data associate to the Parameter Type Code element. These two elements are sent as a matched pair to define various parameters service or feature being provisioned.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="500"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PasswordType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Password holds the text string specified by a PARTY as credential to be used with a Login Userid to uniquely identify them to a system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ResourceActionCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Resource Action Code identifies the activity performed on a Resource in a transaction. Possible Values: A - Add, C - Change, R - Remove, V - Recover, U - Resume</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ResourceChangeReasonCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Resource Change Reason Code contains the code for the reason this resource is being changed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ResumeInternetProtocolFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Resume Internet Protocol Flag determines if Static IP address in aging status will be resumed (when set to`true') or whether a new Static IP address will be assigned (when set to`false').</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SequenceNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sequence Number is a unique positive integer assigned to an item in a list of items. It is used to determine order in a list of items or to identify a specific item.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:double"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceOrderCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Service Order Code - Ensemble</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="9"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceOrderCodeTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Service Order Code Type Code identifies the various types of Service Order Codes. Valid values include (not exclusive list): B - Buy One Get One SOC I - P - Price Plan M - Reduced Price Plan S - Reduced SOC R - Regular SOC O - Optional SOC</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceOrderEffectiveFromDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Service Order Effective Date holds the calendar day when a service order becomes active.
Elements declared to be of type date must follow this form: CCYY-MM-DD range for CC is: 00-99 range for YY is: 00-99 range for MM is: 01-12 range for DD is: 01-28 if month is 2 01-29 if month is 2 and the gYear is a leap gYear 01-30 if month is 4, 6, 9, or 11 01-31 if month is 1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 10, or 12
Example: 1999-05-31 represents May 31, 1999</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceOrderExpirationDateType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date which the SOC expires or becomes inactive.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SidNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>SID Number or System Identification Number is a 5-digit number that has been assigned to identify a particular cellular carrier. This number identifies your ''home'' system.Anchor Switch Identifier(SID) is a five-digit number established by the FCC to represent a city or territory. It's CIBER assigned, used in the industry to identify wireless service providers. SID's are one for one with major trading areas. The SID is the lowest level used to determine traveling or roaming at this time.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriberIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscriber Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies a subscriber.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="TransactionTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transaction Type Code identifies the Create, Read, Update or Delete (CRUD) functionality of the transaction.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Type Code differentiates the various categories or subtypes of an Object.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UrbanAreaIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urban Area Identifier identifies an urban area in the UFMI. It is the first element of the DirectConnect UFMI number. The format of the UFMI number is: Urban Area Id * Fleet Id * Member Id. Example 164*100*3441.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="7"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UrbanFleetMemberIdentifierStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urban Fleet Member Identifier String contains the concatenation of the Urban Identifier,'*' Fleet Identifier, '*' and Member IDentifier used to identify the Direct Connect Subscriber in the iDen network.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/queryDeviceLockStatus/v1/queryDeviceLockStatus.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.1" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/queryDeviceLockStatus/v1/queryDeviceLockStatus.xsd"> <!--Date Author Version Change Rel SR#--> <!--07/03/2012 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.0 Initial Draft - based on queryGsmSimLockStatus API GBL12.3 PJ005782 LTE Device Phase 4--> <xs:element name="queryDeviceLockStatus" type="tns:QueryDeviceLockStatusRequestType"/> <xs:element name="queryDeviceLockStatusResponse" type="tns:QueryDeviceLockStatusResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="QueryDeviceLockStatusRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="info" type="tns:SearchCriteriaType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Search Criteria</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="resellerPartnerId" type="tns:ResellerPartnerIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reseller Partner Id or BAN of the MVNO subscriber requesting the lock/unlock. Required for Ensemble Wholesale subscribers - ENW</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="QueryDeviceLockStatusResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="message" type="tns:ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Message indicating transaction is completed successfully</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unlockDateTime" type="tns:EventDateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>DateTime the device was unlocked</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SearchCriteriaType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Phone number of the subscriber.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="36"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EquipmentPersonalIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Equipment Personal Identification Number is a secret numeric/integer password used to authorize or bind one device to another. name="ban" type="tns:BillingAccountNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Number</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="carrierId" type="tns:CarrierNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates the subscriberâ€™s brand affiliation (Sprint, Boost or the resellerId)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="usageMode" type="tns:SubscriptionTypeNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates if the subscriber is postpaid or prepaid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="zipcode" type="tns:UspsPostalCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>5-digit Zip code of subscriberâ€™s primary address</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique Integrated Circuit Card Identifier (ICCID) of the removable UICC.
Required if device id/manufacturer/device model number are not provided in the request.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="secuityGroup" type="tns:SecurityGroupIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The policy ID of the customerâ€™s BAN</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="epsRoamPolicy" type="tns:DevicePolicyIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Roam policy of the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="QueryPrlInfoResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="prlId" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The PRL ID assignment based upon the API input, the PRL assignment Rules and Hierarchy definition. Required if request device is CDMA capable.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ehplmnId" type="tns:PublicLandMobileNetworkIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The EHPLMN associated to the LTE-capable device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="hplmnId" type="tns:PublicLandMobileNetworkIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The HPLMN associated to the LTE-capable device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mlplId" type="tns:MultimodeSystemSelectorLocationPriorityListIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The MLPL associated to the LTE-capable device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msplId" type="tns:MultimodeSystemSelectorSystemPriorityListIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The MSPL associated to the LTE-capable device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="oplmnId" type="tns:PublicLandMobileNetworkIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The OPLMN associated to the LTE-capable device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="BillingAccountNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Number uniquely identifies an instance of Billing Account used to accrue charges for invoicing.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BillingAccountSubTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Subscriber Type Code further categorizes the Billing Account within the context of the assigned Billing Account Type Code used primarily for Customer segmentation in General Ledger reporting and collection treatment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BillingAccountTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing Account Type Code identifies the account type of the BILLING ACCOUNT. It is used mainly for segregation of the G/L reporting and Collection treatment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CarrierNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Carrier Name designates the a carrier providing the service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CommunicationServiceAreaIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Communication Service Area Identifier uniquely identifies an instance of a geographic area (CSA) served by a communication service provider, which can be broken down into regional, metropolitan, district and smaller sections called ''leaves.''</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ConfirmationMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirmationi Message Text is a string with a confirmation message returned from the called API.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="99"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DevicePolicyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Policy Identifier uniquely identifies a policy which will be applied to a device to limit access, control list, services etc.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PublicLandMobileNetworkIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) Identifier is identified by the Mobile Country Code (MCC) and the Mobile Network Code (MNC). Each operator providing mobile services has its own PLMN. PLMNs interconnect with other PLMNs and Public switched telephone networks (PSTN) for telephone communications or with internet service providers for data and internet access of which links are defined as interconnect links between providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manufacturer Name is the full name of the manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number (MDN) is the actual phone number one would dial to reach a specific mobile phone. Prior to Wireless Number Portability, MDN was the same number as the Mobile Identification Number (MIN) for many mobile phones. But now that MDNs can be ported (moved) to other carriers, MDN and MIN will be different for ported numbers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileStationIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identity (MSID) is the number that is associated with the home service provider and the wireless phone number. This is reprogrammed when the user changes home service providers.
MSID is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MultimodeSystemSelectorLocationPriorityListIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Multimode System Selector (MMSS) Location Priority List (MLPL) identifies an entry for any location in the network where there are Third Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) and 3GPP2 systems available. The entry that ties back to the Perferred Roaming List (PRL) Mobile Country Code (MCC)- Mobile Network Code (MNC) Rev E entry to group nearby systems together, similar to Geo groups in the PRL and provides an index to the MSPL table to determine technology priority in this location</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MultimodeSystemSelectorSystemPriorityListIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Multimode System Selector (MMSS) System Priority List (MSPL) identifies priorities among systems located together. Unlike the Preferred Roaming list (PRL), it can include both Third Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) and 3GPP2 systems in order to allow the device to choose the most preferred system in a specific location.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Name is the name of a file which resides in a handset's memory and contains a list of Sprint PCS and cellular network information. The PRL can assist the handset with acquisition of the Sprint PCS network and when a customer is roaming, the file directs the handset to acquire a signal from one of our roaming partners.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SecurityGroupIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Security Group Identifier designates a group users which may access account information under the same security priveleges.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="StockKeepingUnitType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Stock Keeping Unit represents the Sprint Inventory Stock Keeping Unit (SKU). Stock Keeping Unit identifies a group of PRODUCT instances. It could identify a handset Model and Model Number, a Kit or an accessory. Previously length = 18.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriptionTypeNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subcription Type Name designates the name of the type of subscription for the account. Valid Values Include: PREPAID = Non-contract (pre-paid) POSTPAID = Contract (post-paid)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a unique identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UspsPostalCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>USPS Postal Code contains the first 5 characters of the nine digit USPS Postal Code.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>USPS Postal Code contains the first 5 characters of the nine digit USPS Postal Code.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>alias: Ensemble: ADDR_DATA.ADR_ZIP</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Ensemble: ADDR_DATA.ADR_ZIP
The first 5 characters or digits of the address zip code.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UspsStateAbbreviationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>United States Postal Service (USPS) State Abbreviation Code is the set of characters that are selected from a State or Protectorate name and specified by the USPS to represent the name of a State or US Protectorate for the purpose of mail delivery.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="2"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDataDevice/v1/updateDataDevice.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.1" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDataDevice/v1/updateDataDevice.xsd" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Version Description Rel SR#--> <!--06/10/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.0 Initial Revision GBL15.2.0 PJ020573 Epic 364--> <!--07/27/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Changed subscriptionId to optional MID15.3.3 PJ020573 WC2 CR10 Epic 364--> <!----> <xs:element name="updateDataDevice" type="tns:UpdateDataDeviceRequestType"/> <xs:element name="updateDataDeviceResponse" type="tns:UpdateDataDeviceResponseType"/> <!----> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDataDeviceRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceDetailInfo" type="tns:DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="actionType" type="tns:ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Action Type Identifier denotes a particular action that is taken. Valid values: ACT = Activate device DAC = Deactivate device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription ID associated with the device to be activated/deactivated. NMS will create a unique subscriptionId based on the approved userId value. For NNU transactions â€“ send â€˜DSADAYPASSâ€™ Required for activation requests (actionType=â€™ACTâ€™)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier Must be sent with the ESN/MEID when activating a device with removable UICC (serialType â€˜Uâ€™)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDataDeviceResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format. Echoed back from the request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. Echoed back from the request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription ID associated with the device to be activated/deactivated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelNumber" type="tns:ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Model Number.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="manufacturerLocationId" type="tns:DeviceManufacturerLocationIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ID of the manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier Returned for transceivers paired with an ICCID</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="dateTimeStamp" type="tns:ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NMS activity data and time</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="authenticationKey" type="tns:AuthenticationKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Authentication Key of the ESN/MEID. The Authentication key is used to authenticate the handset during Over-the-Air activation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if esnMeidDec is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if esnMeidHex is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activity Date Time is the calendar day and time of day the activity completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Action Type Identifier denotes a particular action that is taken. Valid values: ACT = Activate device DAC = Deactivate device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AuthenticationKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication Key (A-Key) for over the air activation. A 26 character key used to authenticate a handset. The first twenty decimal digits are used for the A-key as converted from the 64 bit A-key. If the A-key is less than 20 decimal digits, it shall be padded with zero's. The A-key checksum shall be 6 decimal digits as converted from the 18 bit checksum. If the checksum is less than 6 decimal digits it shall be padded with zeros.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="26"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceManufacturerLocationIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Device Manufacturer Location Identifier designates the location of the manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriptionIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier uniquely identifies an instance of SUBSCRIPTION</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a unique identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceAddressStatus/v1/updateDeviceAddressStatus.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceAddressStatus/v1/updateDeviceAddressStatus.xsd"> <!--Date Changed By Version Change Description Release--> <!--04/30/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.0 initial version GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--04/30/2014 Adon Powell 1.0 simple types and standardization GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--05/20/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 Changed ValidAddressCodeType from string to integer GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--09/03/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.2 Added termsStatus to the request GBL14.3.0 PJ012352 WC2--> <!--04/24/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.3 Changed DeviceSerialNumberType (element deviceId) maxLen restriction 20 to 64--> <!----> <xs:element name="updateDeviceAddressStatus" type="tns:UpdateDeviceAddressStatusType"/> <xs:element name="updateDeviceAddressStatusResponse" type="tns:UpdateDeviceAddressStatusResponseType"/> <!----> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceAddressStatusType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing the device related information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceAddressStatusResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="message" type="tns:ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator of success</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device unique identifier (MEID/ESN for primary device)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sipUserName" type="tns:UserNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) userName/IMS_PUBLIC_ID (IMPU) assigned to the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The IMSI of the LTE capable device for both embedded and removable UICC</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="addressStatus" type="tns:ValidAddressCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The status flag of the address registration of the device location. 0 â€“ device has not assigned an address 1 â€“ device has an assigned address</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="termsStatus" type="tns:ValidAddressCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This status flag describes whether the user has accepted Carrierâ€™s terms and conditions â€¢ 0 â€“ TandC Not available â€¢ 1 â€“ TandC are available</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confrim Msg Text is a string with a confirmation message returned from the called API.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="99"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is the value of a electronic serial number (ESN) OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID). This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="64"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ValidAddressCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Valid Address code is an indicator of whether the associated address is valid. Valid Values: true - the associated address is valid false - the associated address is NOT valid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UserNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>User Name is an identifier of the identity associated with a party role which is the public part of a paired identity assertion. User Name consists of all of the characters preceding the @ sign in a URL identifying a member of the specified Domain.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> <!--New Simple Types--> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v6/updateDeviceInfoV6.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="6.1" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v6/updateDeviceInfoV6.xsd" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Change Rel SR#--> <!--02/11/2012 Steve Heichelheim 6.0 Added MVM standards. Added Removable UICC elements GBL12.2 PJ006784--> <!--06/20/2012 Ishita Biswas 6.1 Added brand codes VMU and ASW for Virgin Mobile and Assurance Wireless to annotation, removed enumerations and added length constraint GBL12.3 PJ007442--> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV6" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV6RequestType"/> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV6Response" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV6ResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV6RequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userId" type="tns:DeviceUserIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Alphanumeric User ID. Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="actionType" type="tns:ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Must contain value of: ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator PY = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to â€œYâ€ PN = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to â€œNâ€ PS = Update all AutoPRL fields, set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to â€œNâ€. This action type will be sent for successful PRL updates. AC = Activate ESN/MEID UA = Activate ESN /MEID(alternate) RS = Associate ESN/MEID to reserved subscription ID SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="tns:EffectiveFromDateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date and time of the action. Required for actionType of ST, SF, and PS. It is disregarded for all other action Types.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Info</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Id Required only for activation</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="accountId" type="tns:AccountIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Number Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts
Only required if BillSysCd = â€˜ENWâ€™ or BillSysCd = â€˜ENSâ€™</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number Required only for actionType = â€˜ACâ€™, or â€˜RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlName" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the last AutoPRL that was downloaded. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateUser" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the Auto PRL flag is set, this field should contain the user or system that set the flag. (action type = â€˜PYâ€™, â€˜PNâ€™ and â€˜PSâ€™)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateMethod" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible values are automatic, manual, or OTAPA. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required only for actionType = 'AC', 'DA',or 'RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="billingSytemCode" type="tns:BillingSystemCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: â€˜ENSâ€™ - Ensemblel ENW - EnsembleWholesale</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prepaidInd" type="tns:PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting if the subscriber is Pre Paid or Post Paid Valid Values: true â€“ Pre Paid false â€“ Post Paid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="brandCode" type="tns:BrandCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: BST - Boost SPR â€“ Sprint VMU â€“ Virgin Mobile ASW â€“ Assurance Wireless Req when PrePaidInd = true</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="retailId" type="tns:RetailStoreIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The store ID passed from the retailer to inComm. These are 4 to 6 characters in length, sometimes padded with zeros. Leading zeros should not be stripped off. (Examples: 001859, 1165, 0649)
NOTE: This value should be passed if actionType passed is SP.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="merchantId" type="tns:MerchantNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The retail chain name. (Examples: Walmart, Sams Club, Target)
This value should be passed if actionType passed is SP.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prePayReasonDesc" type="tns:PrePaymentReasonTextType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This will be the description of why the pre-paid status is being changed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="internalLrnFlag" type="tns:InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Y/N indicator. ATA service or internal LRN indicator for new MDN. Default to N if no value passed. Only logic change when ActionType is AC. No logic change for other Action Types</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV6ResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateTimeStamp" type="tns:ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The datetime</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="masterSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:MasterSubsidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 1 of a 2â€“part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="oneTimeKeyPadSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 2 of a 2-part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceHexId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format or MACID</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Valid Values: A â€“ Airave or single-mode WiMax E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="frequencyMode" type="tns:FrequencyModeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: C â€“ CDMA, D â€“ CDMA or AMPS, A â€“ AMPS, T â€“ TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eqFrequencyTypeCode" type="tns:FrequencyTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: P - PCS, C - Cellular, D - PCS and Cellular, K - PCS with EVRC, L - PCS and Cellular with EVRC, M - Hybrid (Tri Mode)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelNumber" type="tns:ModelNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A unique value to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceStatus" type="tns:DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID
Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier The Subscription ID attached to the ESN/MEID being activated. Only populated if we return activation information for provisioning info.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="autoPrlUpdateIndicator" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateNeededFlagType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indication of whether the Preferred Roaming List needs to be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="phoneOwner" type="tns:DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS, PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers, AFFL â€“ Affiliates, FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments, FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack, SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments, PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways, OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="authenticationKey" type="tns:AuthenticationKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication key is used to authenticate the handset during Over-the-Air activation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="manufactureName" type="tns:ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelName" type="tns:ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="revisionKey" type="tns:RevisionKeyStringType" default="000000" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The equipment type. Should be defaulted to '000000'.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mobileCountryCode" type="tns:Iso3CharCountryCodeType" default="310" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Should be defaulted to '310'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if we are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="hsa" type="tns:HomeServiceAreaType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sid" type="tns:SystemIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="numberGroup" type="tns:NumberGroupType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number group of the MDN Being activated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>MSID associated with the MDN being acivated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pseudoEsn" type="tns:ElectronicSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pseudo ESN is populated for MEID. Return only if ESNMEIDHexID return MEID (length > 8)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sharedSecretKey" type="tns:PreSharedKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Shared Secret Key of the Mac. Used to authenticate the device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if esnMeidDec or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if esnMeidHex or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="macId" type="tns:MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Media Access Control Identifier Required if esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec are not provide</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceDetailInfo" type="tns:DeviceDetailInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of (esnMeidHex, esnMeidDec or macId) and conditional fields deviceType and iccId</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required if input is MacID. Valid Values: A â€“ MACID E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card ID. Required for removable UICC and compatibility checks. Otherwise, API will perform a reverse lookup and provide the ICCID if the ESN/MEID is a removable transceiver and a related ICCID is found.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="AccountIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies an account.
Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Action Type Identifier denotes a particular action that is taken. ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator PY = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "Y" PN = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N" PS = Update all AutoPRL fields, set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N". This action type will be sent for successful PRL updates. AC = Activate ESN/MEID UA = Activate ESN /MEID(alternate) RS = Associate ESN/MEID to reserved subscription ID SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="2"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activity Date Time is the calendar day and time of day the activity completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AuthenticationKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication Key (A-Key) for over the air activation. A 26 character key used to authenticate a handset. The first twenty decimal digits are used for the A-key as converted from the 64 bit A-key. If the A-key is less than 20 decimal digits, it shall be padded with zero's. The A-key checksum shall be 6 decimal digits as converted from the 18 bit checksum. If the checksum is less than 6 decimal digits it shall be padded with zeros.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="26"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BillingSystemCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing System Code is a 3 byte indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: ENS - Ensemble ENW - Ensemble Wholesale P2W - Convergys Wholesale</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENS"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENW"/> <xs:enumeration value="NNU"/> <xs:enumeration value="AER"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BrandCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Brand Code is a 3 byte code denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: â€˜BST - Boost â€˜SPRâ€™ â€“ Sprint â€˜VMUâ€™ â€“ Virgin Mobile â€˜ASWâ€™ â€“ Assurance Wireless</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device activation status code is derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Device Owner Code is a 4 byte code that designates the owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers AFFL â€“ Affiliates FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Type Code designates a device type: IMEI(I), MSN(M), SIM(S), Kit (K), or ESN (E) for CDMA platform. Valid values: I - IMEI M - MSN S - SIM K - Kit E - ESN A - Airave (macId)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="E"/> <xs:enumeration value="A"/> <xs:enumeration value="U"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceUserIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device User Identifier is the alphanumeric User ID assocated to device activity.
