Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EffectiveFromDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Effective From Date holds the first calendar month, day, year, hour, minute, second and fraction of a second a Role, Preference, Assignment, etc. was in effect.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ElectronicSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyModeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type Code differentiates the various categories or subtypes of an Object.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Type Code Possible Values: 'C' => CELLULAR 'D' => PCS and CELLULAR 'K' => PCS WITH EVRC 'L' => PCS and CELLULAR WITH EVRC 'M' => HYBRID 'P' => PCS 'S' => ACCESSORY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="HomeServiceAreaType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Home Service Area is the Communication Service Area (CSA) in which a subscriber is domiciled. Used to determine whether travel or roaming charges should apply to an inbound or outbound call.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal Location Routing Number (LRN) Type Code designates if the MDN is associated to an internal LRN or has ATA service. Values: Y - the MDN is associated to an internal LRN N - the MDN has ATA service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Iso3CharCountryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An International Standardization Organization (ISO) is the set of characters assigned by the ISO to identify a soverign nation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>An International Standardization Organization (ISO) 3-Character Country Code is the set of three characters assigned by the ISO to identify a soverign nation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manufacturer Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MasterSubsidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Master Subsidy Lock (MSL)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Medium Access Control Address (MAC Address) contains a 12 byte hexadecimal value used to identify a device used in the IEEE sublayer of a network which controls access to the shared medium by network-attached devices.
In the context of the OSI reference model, the Medium Access Control (MAC) layer extends above to the Data Link Layer and below to the Physical Layer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="12"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MerchantNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Merchant Name is a label applied to those instances of PARTY of type MERCHANT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method of identifying telephone trunks in the public network of North America, called World Numbering Zone 1 by the ITU-T. the Plan has 3 ways of identifying phone numbers in North America -- a 3-digit area code, a 3-digit exchange or central office code, and 4-digit subscriber code.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileStationIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberGroupType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NGP (Number Group) is identified as CSA by the Ensemble billing system and groups ranges for a number of resources such as IPs, IMSIs, NPANXXs, and UFs . This grouping represents a geographical zone that includes specific ranges.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Time Keypad Subsidy Lock (OTKSL)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Name is the name of a file which resides in a handset's memory and contains a list of Sprint PCS and cellular network information. The PRL can assist the handset with acquisition of the Sprint PCS network and when a customer is roaming, the file directs the handset to acquire a signal from one of our roaming partners.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Preferred Roaming List Update method is the method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible Values: automatic manual OTAPA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="automatic"/> <xs:enumeration value="manual"/> <xs:enumeration value="OTAPA"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateNeededFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Preferred Roaming List Update Needed flag is a 1 byte Y/N flag indicating whether the Preferred Roaming List needs to be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Update User is the user or the system that made the update.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PrePaidFlag indicates the Customer is required to pay for service in advance. Valid Value: true - Indicates the account is a pre-paid account. false â€“ Otherwise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaymentReasonTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre-Payment Reason Text is the reason for a pre-payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="200"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreSharedKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre Shared Key (PSK) is a shared secret which was previously shared between the two parties using some secure channel before it needs to be used. Such systems almost always use symmetric key cryptographic algorithms.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="32"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RetailStoreIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retail Store Identifer is the store ID passed from the retailer to inComm. These are 4 to 6 characters in length sometimes padded with zeros. Leading 0s should not be stripped off. (Examples: 001859, 1165, 0649)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RevisionKeyStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Revision Key String is associated to the equipment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier Ensemble uniquely identifies an instance of SUBSCRIPTION in the Ensemble system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SystemIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>System Identification Number (SID) which is assigned to identify a particular cellular carrier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a uniqe identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v7/updateDeviceInfoV7.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.8" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v7/updateDeviceInfoV7.xsd" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Version Change Rel SR#/Ticket#--> <!--11/5/2013 Ibrahim ElKhatib 7.0 initial version (based on updateDeviceInfoV6) GBL14.1 PJ009752--> <!--11/6/2013 Adon Powell 7.0 standardization GBL14.1 PJ009752--> <!--01/14/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 7.1 Changed the length of DeviceSerialNumberType (element csn) from 20 to 40 GBL14.1 PJ009752 CR#14--> <!--06/30/2014 Ted Burbidge 7.2 Added giveBackStatus, retailerId, loanNumber and deviceCondition to giveBackInfo MID14.3 PJ012336 EPIC 4--> <!--07/03/2014 Kathy Zhao 7.2 Standardization--> <!--07/14/2014 Kathy Zhao 7.2 Modified the LoanIdentifierType to integer with 9 digits--> <!--07/16/2014 Ted Buribdge 7.3 Removed RetailID field in order to correspond to NMS IDD--> <!--08/20/2014 Paula Muller 7.4 Added 2 new actionTypes = CA,CD in annotation. Updated annotation to accountID. Added enumeraion of CCA to BillingSystemCode field--> <!--09/20/2014 Paula Muller 7.5 Updated annotation for phoneOwner in response - added CCAD value. GBL14.3.0 PJ012686--> <!--09/18/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 7.6 Removed the empty final attribute from DeviceStatusCodetype GBL14.3.0 PJ012686--> <!--09/18/2014 Ted Burbidge 7.7 Remove annotation in accountId field that accountId is required for billSysCode = 'ENS'--> <!--09/23/2015 Cindy Pummill 7.8 Removed enumeration for DeviceStatusCodetype GBL15.3.0 PJ020772 Epic 512--> <!----> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV7" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV7RequestType"/> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV7Response" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV7ResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV7RequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userId" type="tns:DeviceUserIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Alphanumeric User ID. Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="actionType" type="tns:ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Must contain value of: ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0) CP = Change ESN/ICCID pairing DI = Change ESN MODEL_NUMBER and PHONE_OWNER values RS = Remove Surplus flag SS = Set Surplus flag SI = Set/update CSN/BIND_PIN values for an ESIM device RI = Remove CSN/BIND_PIN for an ESIM device GB - Give Back scenario
CA = Activate CCA Device CD = Deactivate CCA Device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="tns:EffectiveFromDateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date and time of the action. Required for actionType of ST, SF, and PS. It is disregarded for all other action Types.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Info</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="accountId" type="tns:AccountIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Number Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts
Only required if BillSysCd = â€˜ENWâ€™
Also required for CCA devices if actionType is â€˜CAâ€™ or â€˜CDâ€™. The CCA front end will need to pass the carrierId in the accountId field.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number Required only for actionType = â€˜RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlName" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the last AutoPRL that was downloaded. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateUser" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the Auto PRL flag is set, this field should contain the user or system that set the flag. (action type = â€˜PYâ€™, â€˜PNâ€™ and â€˜PSâ€™)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateMethod" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible values are automatic, manual, or OTAPA. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required only for actionType = 'DA'or 'RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="billingSytemCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: â€˜ENSâ€™ - Ensemblel ENW - EnsembleWholesale â€˜NNUâ€™ â€“ Net Near You Day Pass â€˜AERâ€™ - Aeris M2M 'CCA' - Competitive Carrier Association</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="tns:BillingSystemCodeType"/> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prepaidInd" type="tns:PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting if the subscriber is Pre Paid or Post Paid Valid Values: true â€“ Pre Paid false â€“ Post Paid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="brandCode" type="tns:BrandCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: BST - Boost SPR â€“ Sprint VMU â€“ Virgin Mobile ASW â€“ Assurance Wireless Req when PrePaidInd = true</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="merchantId" type="tns:MerchantNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The retail chain name. (Examples: Walmart, Sams Club, Target)
This value should be passed if actionType passed is SP.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prePayReasonDesc" type="tns:PrePaymentReasonTextType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This will be the description of why the pre-paid status is being changed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="internalLrnFlag" type="tns:InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Y/N indicator. ATA service or internal LRN indicator for new MDN. Default to N if no value passed. Only logic change when ActionType is AC. No logic change for other Action Types</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="giveBackInfo" type="tns:GiveBackInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>giveback structure</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV7ResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateTimeStamp" type="tns:ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The datetime</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="masterSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:MasterSubsidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 1 of a 2â€“part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="oneTimeKeyPadSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 2 of a 2-part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceHexId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format or MACID</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Valid Values: A â€“ Airave or single-mode WiMax E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="frequencyMode" type="tns:FrequencyModeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: C â€“ CDMA, D â€“ CDMA or AMPS, A â€“ AMPS, T â€“ TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eqFrequencyTypeCode" type="tns:FrequencyTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: P - PCS, C - Cellular, D - PCS and Cellular, K - PCS with EVRC, L - PCS and Cellular with EVRC, M - Hybrid (Tri Mode)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelNumber" type="tns:ModelNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A unique value to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceStatus" type="tns:DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID
Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier The Subscription ID attached to the ESN/MEID being activated. Only populated if we return activation information for provisioning info.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="autoPrlUpdateIndicator" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateNeededFlagType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indication of whether the Preferred Roaming List needs to be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="phoneOwner" type="tns:DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS, PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers, AFFL â€“ Affiliates, FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments, FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack, SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments, PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways, OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units CCAD - Competitive Carrier Association Device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="authenticationKey" type="tns:AuthenticationKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication key is used to authenticate the handset during Over-the-Air activation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="manufactureName" type="tns:ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelName" type="tns:ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="revisionKey" type="tns:RevisionKeyStringType" default="000000" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The equipment type. Should be defaulted to '000000'.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mobileCountryCode" type="tns:Iso3CharCountryCodeType" default="310" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Should be defaulted to '310'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if we are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="hsa" type="tns:HomeServiceAreaType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sid" type="tns:SystemIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="numberGroup" type="tns:NumberGroupType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number group of the MDN Being activated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>MSID associated with the MDN being acivated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pseudoEsn" type="tns:ElectronicSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pseudo ESN is populated for MEID. Return only if ESNMEIDHexID return MEID (length > 8)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sharedSecretKey" type="tns:PreSharedKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Shared Secret Key of the Mac. Used to authenticate the device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device-level International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) of a subscriber. (Not to be confused with the IMSI/MSID resource assigned to the subscriber).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if esnMeidDec or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if esnMeidHex or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="macId" type="tns:MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Media Access Control Identifier Required if esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec are not provide</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceDetailInfo" type="tns:DeviceDetailInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of (esnMeidHex, esnMeidDec or macId) and conditional fields deviceType and iccId</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required if input is MacID. Valid Values: A â€“ MACID E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card ID. Required for removable UICC and compatibility checks. Otherwise, API will perform a reverse lookup and provide the ICCID if the ESN/MEID is a removable transceiver and a related ICCID is found.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="csn" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Card Serial Number to pair with the eSIM device. Required for actionType: SI; ignored otherwise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="GiveBackInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="giveBackStatus" type="tns:GiveBackStatusCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required for actionType = GB P - pending S - surrendered R - returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="retailerId" type="tns:RetailStoreIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The retailer ID the device is being returned to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="loanNumber" type="tns:LoanIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required for actionType = GB. The loan number of the device give-back, which is expected by NMS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceCondition" type="tns:DeviceStatusCodetype" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Captures the state of the give-back device. Valid values include: 0 - Device is in good shape; default 1 - Device cannot power on 2 - LCD screen is damaged</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="AccountIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies an account.
Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Action Type Identifier denotes a particular action that is taken. ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator PY = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "Y" PN = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N" PS = Update all AutoPRL fields, set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N". This action type will be sent for successful PRL updates. AC = Activate ESN/MEID UA = Activate ESN /MEID(alternate) RS = Associate ESN/MEID to reserved subscription ID SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="2"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activity Date Time is the calendar day and time of day the activity completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AuthenticationKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication Key (A-Key) for over the air activation. A 26 character key used to authenticate a handset. The first twenty decimal digits are used for the A-key as converted from the 64 bit A-key. If the A-key is less than 20 decimal digits, it shall be padded with zero's. The A-key checksum shall be 6 decimal digits as converted from the 18 bit checksum. If the checksum is less than 6 decimal digits it shall be padded with zeros.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="26"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BillingSystemCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing System Code is a 3 byte indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: ENS - Ensemble ENW - Ensemble Wholesale P2W - Convergys Wholesale</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENS"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENW"/> <xs:enumeration value="NNU"/> <xs:enumeration value="AER"/> <xs:enumeration value="CCA"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BrandCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Brand Code is a 3 byte code denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: â€˜BST - Boost â€˜SPRâ€™ â€“ Sprint â€˜VMUâ€™ â€“ Virgin Mobile â€˜ASWâ€™ â€“ Assurance Wireless</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device activation status code is derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Device Owner Code is a 4 byte code that designates the owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers AFFL â€“ Affiliates FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="40"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Type Code designates a device type: IMEI(I), MSN(M), SIM(S), Kit (K), or ESN (E) for CDMA platform. Valid values: I - IMEI M - MSN S - SIM K - Kit E - ESN A - Airave (macId)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="E"/> <xs:enumeration value="A"/> <xs:enumeration value="U"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceUserIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device User Identifier is the alphanumeric User ID assocated to device activity. Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EffectiveFromDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Effective From Date holds the first calendar month, day, year, hour, minute, second and fraction of a second a Role, Preference, Assignment, etc. was in effect.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ElectronicSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyModeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type Code differentiates the various categories or subtypes of an Object.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Type Code Possible Values: 'C' => CELLULAR 'D' => PCS and CELLULAR 'K' => PCS WITH EVRC 'L' => PCS and CELLULAR WITH EVRC 'M' => HYBRID 'P' => PCS 'S' => ACCESSORY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="HomeServiceAreaType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Home Service Area is the Communication Service Area (CSA) in which a subscriber is domiciled. Used to determine whether travel or roaming charges should apply to an inbound or outbound call.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal Location Routing Number (LRN) Type Code designates if the MDN is associated to an internal LRN or has ATA service. Values: Y - the MDN is associated to an internal LRN N - the MDN has ATA service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="16"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Iso3CharCountryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An International Standardization Organization (ISO) is the set of characters assigned by the ISO to identify a soverign nation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>An International Standardization Organization (ISO) 3-Character Country Code is the set of three characters assigned by the ISO to identify a soverign nation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manufacturer Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MasterSubsidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Master Subsidy Lock (MSL)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Medium Access Control Address (MAC Address) contains a 12 byte hexadecimal value used to identify a device used in the IEEE sublayer of a network which controls access to the shared medium by network-attached devices.
In the context of the OSI reference model, the Medium Access Control (MAC) layer extends above to the Data Link Layer and below to the Physical Layer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="12"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MerchantNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Merchant Name is a label applied to those instances of PARTY of type MERCHANT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method of identifying telephone trunks in the public network of North America, called World Numbering Zone 1 by the ITU-T. the Plan has 3 ways of identifying phone numbers in North America -- a 3-digit area code, a 3-digit exchange or central office code, and 4-digit subscriber code.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileStationIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberGroupType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The NGP (Number Group) is identified as CSA by the Ensemble billing system and groups ranges for a number of resources such as IPs, IMSIs, NPANXXs, and UFs . This grouping represents a geographical zone that includes specific ranges.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Time Keypad Subsidy Lock (OTKSL)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Name is the name of a file which resides in a handset's memory and contains a list of Sprint PCS and cellular network information. The PRL can assist the handset with acquisition of the Sprint PCS network and when a customer is roaming, the file directs the handset to acquire a signal from one of our roaming partners.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Preferred Roaming List Update method is the method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible Values: automatic manual OTAPA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="automatic"/> <xs:enumeration value="manual"/> <xs:enumeration value="OTAPA"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateNeededFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Preferred Roaming List Update Needed flag is a 1 byte Y/N flag indicating whether the Preferred Roaming List needs to be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Update User is the user or the system that made the update.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PrePaidFlag indicates the Customer is required to pay for service in advance. Valid Value: true - Indicates the account is a pre-paid account. false â€“ Otherwise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaymentReasonTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre-Payment Reason Text is the reason for a pre-payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="200"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreSharedKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre Shared Key (PSK) is a shared secret which was previously shared between the two parties using some secure channel before it needs to be used. Such systems almost always use symmetric key cryptographic algorithms.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="32"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RetailStoreIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retail Store Identifer is the store ID passed from the retailer to inComm. These are 4 to 6 characters in length sometimes padded with zeros. Leading 0s should not be stripped off. (Examples: 001859, 1165, 0649)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RevisionKeyStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Revision Key String is associated to the equipment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriptionIdentifierEnsType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier Ensemble uniquely identifies an instance of SUBSCRIPTION in the Ensemble system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SystemIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>System Identification Number (SID) which is assigned to identify a particular cellular carrier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a uniqe identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LoanIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Loan Identifier uniquely identifies a loan and is assigned by the originator of the loan.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="9"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceStatusCodetype"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Captures the state of the give-back device. Valid values include: 0 â€“ Device is in good shape; default 1 â€“ Device cannot power on 2 â€“ LCD screen is damaged</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="GiveBackStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Give Back Status Code designates the status of the Give Back process. Required for actionType = GB P â€“ pending S â€“ surrendered R â€“ returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v8/updateDeviceInfoV8.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.1" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/updateDeviceInfo/v8/updateDeviceInfoV8.xsd" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--Date Author Version Change Rel SR#/Ticket#--> <!--07/28/2015 Jocelen Silva 1.0 Initial version (based on updateDeviceInfoV7) MID15.3.1 PJ012223 EPIC 193--> <!--07/28/2015 Steve Heichelheim 1.0 Standardize MID15.3.1 PJ012223 EPIC 193--> <!--09/23/2015 Cindy Pummill 1.1 Removed enumeration for DeviceStatusCodetype GBL15.3.0 PJ020772 Epic 512--> <!----> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV8" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV8RequestType"/> <xs:element name="updateDeviceInfoV8Response" type="tns:UpdateDeviceInfoV8ResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV8RequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="userId" type="tns:DeviceUserIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Alphanumeric User ID. Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="actionType" type="tns:ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Must contain value of: ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0) CP = Change ESN/ICCID pairing DI = Change ESN MODEL_NUMBER and PHONE_OWNER values RS = Remove Surplus flag SS = Set Surplus flag SI = Set/update CSN/BIND_PIN values for an ESIM device RI = Remove CSN/BIND_PIN for an ESIM device GB - Give Back scenario
CA = Activate CCA Device CD = Deactivate CCA Device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="tns:EffectiveFromDateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The date and time of the action. Required for actionType of ST, SF, and PS. It is disregarded for all other action Types.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Info</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriberIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="accountId" type="tns:AccountIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Number Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts
Only required if BillSysCd = â€˜ENWâ€™
Also required for CCA devices if actionType is â€˜CAâ€™ or â€˜CDâ€™. The CCA front end will need to pass the carrierId in the accountId field.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number Required only for actionType = â€˜RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlName" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the last AutoPRL that was downloaded. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateUser" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the Auto PRL flag is set, this field should contain the user or system that set the flag. (action type = â€˜PYâ€™, â€˜PNâ€™ and â€˜PSâ€™)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prlUpdateMethod" type="tns:PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible values are automatic, manual, or OTAPA. Required for successful PRL downloads (action type = 'PS')</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required only for actionType = 'DA'or 'RS'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="billingSytemCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: â€˜ENSâ€™ - Ensemblel ENW - EnsembleWholesale â€˜NNUâ€™ â€“ Net Near You Day Pass â€˜AERâ€™ - Aeris M2M 'CCA' - Competitive Carrier Association</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="tns:BillingSystemCodeType"/> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prepaidInd" type="tns:PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting if the subscriber is Pre Paid or Post Paid Valid Values: true â€“ Pre Paid false â€“ Post Paid</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="brandCode" type="tns:BrandCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicator denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: BST - Boost SPR â€“ Sprint VMU â€“ Virgin Mobile ASW â€“ Assurance Wireless Req when PrePaidInd = true</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="merchantId" type="tns:MerchantNameType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The retail chain name. (Examples: Walmart, Sams Club, Target)
This value should be passed if actionType passed is SP.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="prePayReasonDesc" type="tns:PrePaymentReasonTextType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This will be the description of why the pre-paid status is being changed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="internalLrnFlag" type="tns:InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Y/N indicator. ATA service or internal LRN indicator for new MDN. Default to N if no value passed. Only logic change when ActionType is AC. No logic change for other Action Types</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="giveBackInfo" type="tns:GiveBackInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>giveback structure</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UpdateDeviceInfoV8ResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateTimeStamp" type="tns:ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The datetime</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="masterSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:MasterSubsidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 1 of a 2â€“part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="oneTimeKeyPadSubsidiaryLock" type="tns:OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used as part 2 of a 2-part authentication</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceHexId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format or MACID</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Valid Values: A â€“ Airave or single-mode WiMax E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="frequencyMode" type="tns:FrequencyModeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: C â€“ CDMA, D â€“ CDMA or AMPS, A â€“ AMPS, T â€“ TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eqFrequencyTypeCode" type="tns:FrequencyTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Possible values: P - PCS, C - Cellular, D - PCS and Cellular, K - PCS with EVRC, L - PCS and Cellular with EVRC, M - Hybrid (Tri Mode)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelNumber" type="tns:ModelNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A unique value to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceStatus" type="tns:DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID
Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="subscriptionId" type="tns:SubscriberIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscription Identifier The Subscription ID attached to the ESN/MEID being activated. Only populated if we return activation information for provisioning info.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="autoPrlUpdateIndicator" type="tns:UpdateFlagType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indication of whether the Preferred Roaming List needs to be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="phoneOwner" type="tns:DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS, PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers, AFFL â€“ Affiliates, FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments, FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack, SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments, PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways, OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units CCAD - Competitive Carrier Association Device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="authenticationKey" type="tns:AuthenticationKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Authentication key is used to authenticate the handset during Over-the-Air activation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="manufactureName" type="tns:ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the manufacturer</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="modelName" type="tns:ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="revisionKey" type="tns:RevisionKeyStringType" default="000000" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The equipment type. Should be defaulted to '000000'.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mobileCountryCode" type="tns:Iso3CharCountryCodeType" default="310" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Should be defaulted to '310'</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="mdn" type="tns:MobileDirectoryNumberStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if we are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="hsa" type="tns:HomeServiceAreaType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sid" type="tns:SystemIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Only contains a value if NMS are returning active information for provisioning information.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="numberGroup" type="tns:NumberGroupType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number group of the MDN Being activated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="msid" type="tns:MobileStationIdentificationNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>MSID associated with the MDN being acivated. Only returned if the ESN/MEID is active.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="pseudoEsn" type="tns:ElectronicSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pseudo ESN is populated for MEID. Return only if ESNMEIDHexID return MEID (length > 8)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sharedSecretKey" type="tns:PreSharedKeyType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Shared Secret Key of the Mac. Used to authenticate the device</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card Identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device-level International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) of a subscriber. (Not to be confused with the IMSI/MSID resource assigned to the subscriber).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceDetailInfoType"> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="esnMeidHex" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if esnMeidDec or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="esnMeidDec" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if esnMeidHex or macId are not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="macId" type="tns:MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Media Access Control Identifier Required if esnMeidHex or esnMeidDec are not provide</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceDetailInfo" type="tns:DeviceDetailInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing choice of (esnMeidHex, esnMeidDec or macId) and conditional fields deviceType and iccId</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceType" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required if input is MacID. Valid Values: A â€“ MACID E - CDMA, embedded LTE or dual-mode WIMAX U â€“ removable transceiver/USIM (Default to E if no value included in response)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Integrated Circuit Card ID. Required for removable UICC and compatibility checks. Otherwise, API will perform a reverse lookup and provide the ICCID if the ESN/MEID is a removable transceiver and a related ICCID is found.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="csn" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Card Serial Number to pair with the eSIM device. Required for actionType: SI; ignored otherwise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="skuType" type="tns:StockKeepingUnitTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>SKU Type Required for actionType=DI; ignored otherwise. Valid values: NEW INTL BYO If not sent will be defaulted to NEW.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="GiveBackInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="giveBackStatus" type="tns:GiveBackStatusCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required for actionType = GB P - pending S - surrendered R - returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="retailerId" type="tns:RetailStoreIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The retailer ID the device is being returned to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="loanNumber" type="tns:LoanIdentifierType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Required for actionType = GB. The loan number of the device give-back, which is expected by NMS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceCondition" type="tns:DeviceStatusCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Captures the state of the give-back device. Valid values include: 0 - Device is in good shape; default 1 - Device cannot power on 2 - LCD screen is damaged</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="AccountIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies an account.
Required for activating a reseller ESN/MEID to verify the ESN/MEID and the account are both reseller specific. Required for Ensemble accounts</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActionTypeIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Action Type Identifier denotes a particular action that is taken. ST = Stolen date will be set RC = Stolen date must already be set, and will be cleared SF = Set the Fraud indicator RF = Reset Fraud indicator PY = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "Y" PN = Set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N" PS = Update all AutoPRL fields, set AutoPRL Update Needed flag to "N". This action type will be sent for successful PRL updates. AC = Activate ESN/MEID UA = Activate ESN /MEID(alternate) RS = Associate ESN/MEID to reserved subscription ID SP = Set pre-paid code to unprovisionable (disposition_code = 3) RP = Reset pre-paid code to provisionable (disposition_code = 0)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="2"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActivityDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activity Date Time is the calendar day and time of day the activity completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AuthenticationKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Authentication Key (A-Key) for over the air activation. A 26 character key used to authenticate a handset. The first twenty decimal digits are used for the A-key as converted from the 64 bit A-key. If the A-key is less than 20 decimal digits, it shall be padded with zero's. The A-key checksum shall be 6 decimal digits as converted from the 18 bit checksum. If the checksum is less than 6 decimal digits it shall be padded with zeros.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="26"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BillingSystemCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Billing System Code is a 3 byte indicator denoting which billing system is initiating the transaction Valid values: ENS - Ensemble ENW - Ensemble Wholesale P2W - Convergys Wholesale</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENS"/> <xs:enumeration value="ENW"/> <xs:enumeration value="NNU"/> <xs:enumeration value="AER"/> <xs:enumeration value="CCA"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BrandCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Brand Code is a 3 byte code denoting which brand the pre-paid subscriber belongs to Valid values: â€˜BST - Boost â€˜SPRâ€™ â€“ Sprint â€˜VMUâ€™ â€“ Virgin Mobile â€˜ASWâ€™ â€“ Assurance Wireless</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceActivationStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Activation Status Code is derived by NMS using the Activation_Status and Disposition_Code of the ESN or MEID Valid Values: E â€“ Enabled (active) D â€“ Disabled (not active) L â€“ Lost/Stolen F â€“ Fraudulent N â€“ Non existent P â€“ Pre-Paid Unprovisionable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceOwnerCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Owner Code is a 4 byte code that designates the owner of the handset. Possible values include: SPCS â€“ Sprint PCS PLBL â€“ Private Label Resellers AFFL â€“ Affiliates FACT â€“ Sprint PCS Factory Direct Shipments FDRS â€“ Factory Direct Shipments for Radio Shack SPHI â€“ Sprint PCS Hawaii Shipments PROM â€“ Promotional Phone Giveaways OMNI â€“ Qualcomm OmniExpress Units</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="40"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Type Code designates a device type: IMEI(I), MSN(M), SIM(S), Kit (K), or ESN (E) for CDMA platform. Valid values: I - IMEI M - MSN S - SIM K - Kit E - ESN A - Airave (macId)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="E"/> <xs:enumeration value="A"/> <xs:enumeration value="U"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Status Code uniquely identifies the status of a device. Example Values include: 0 â€“ Device is in good shape 1 â€“ Device cannot power on 2 â€“ LCD screen is damagedÂ </xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"></xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceUserIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device User Identifier is the alphanumeric User ID assocated to device activity. Valid characters are 0 - 9 and A - Z. The User ID may be a system ID in the case of PRL updates.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EffectiveFromDateTimeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Effective From Date holds the first calendar month, day, year, hour, minute, second and fraction of a second a Role, Preference, Assignment, etc. was in effect.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ElectronicSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Electronic Serial Number is a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a CDMA wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit. It can be represented in 11-digit decimal or 8-digit hexadecimal (HEX) format. Once ESNs are exhausted, MEIDs are embedded in devices to uniquely identify the device. This is the 8 digit hexidecimal representation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyModeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Mode Code
Possible Values: 'A' => AMPS 'C' => CDMA 'D' => CDMA and AMPS 'S' => ACCESSORY 'T' => TDMA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="FrequencyTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Frequency Type Code indicates what type of radio or radios the device is equipped with. Possible Values: C - CELLULAR D - PCS and CELLULAR K - PCS WITH EVRC L - PCS and CELLULAR WITH EVRC M - HYBRID P - PCS S - ACCESSORY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="GiveBackStatusCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Give Back Status Code designates the status of the Give Back process. Required for actionType = GB P â€“ pending S â€“ surrendered R â€“ returned</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="1"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="HomeServiceAreaType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Home Service Area is the Communication Service Area (CSA) in which a subscriber is domiciled. Used to determine whether travel or roaming charges should apply to an inbound or outbound call.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternalLocationRoutingNumberTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal Location Routing Number (LRN) Type Code designates if the MDN is associated to an internal LRN or has ATA service. Values: Y - the MDN is associated to an internal LRN N - the MDN has ATA service</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register.
