In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="16"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Iso3CharCountryCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Standardization Organization (ISO) 3-Character Country Code is the set of three characters assigned by the ISO to identify a soverign nation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="3"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LoanIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Loan Identifier uniquely identifies a loan and is assigned by the originator of the loan.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:totalDigits value="9"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ManufacturerNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Manufacturer Name is the full name of the manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MasterSubsidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Master Subsidy Lock (MSL) is used for programming the handset when the one-time subsidy lock code fails due to error, or when the phone needs to be reprogrammed for any reason.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MediumAccessControlAddressType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Medium Access Control Address (MAC Address) contains a 12 byte hexadecimal value used to identify a device used in the IEEE sublayer of a network which controls access to the shared medium by network-attached devices.
In the context of the OSI reference model, the Medium Access Control (MAC) layer extends above to the Data Link Layer and below to the Physical Layer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="12"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MerchantNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Merchant Name is a label applied to those instances of PARTY of type MERCHANT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileDirectoryNumberStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Directory Number (MDN) is the actual phone number one would dial to reach a specific mobile phone. Prior to Wireless Number Portability, MDN was the same number as the Mobile Identification Number (MIN) for many mobile phones. But now that MDNs can be ported (moved) to other carriers, MDN and MIN will be different for ported numbers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MobileStationIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Mobile Station Identification Number (MSID) is the internal identifying number for a CDMA handset's phone number under Local Number Portability. Mobile Station Identification Number stays with the carrier while the MDN stays with the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Name holds the Manufacturer's name for the class or model of PRODUCT.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ModelNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Model Number contains a unique value within the class of PRODUCT identified by Model Name used to identify the type of equipment being shipped by the Manufacturer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="NumberGroupType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Number Group (NGP) is identified as CSA by the Ensemble billing system and groups ranges for a number of resources such as IPs, IMSIs, NPANXXs, and UFs . This grouping represents a geographical zone that includes specific ranges.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OneTimeKeypadSubisidyLockCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>One Time Keypad Subsidy Lock (OTKSL) Code is a six-digit code used by CDMA phones as an activation code. It is used to activate a brand new phone onto wireless service, and it works only one time. This code makes it possible for a consumer to purchase the phone anywhere, call up the provider's toll-free number, and then activate the wireless phone from the directions given by the representative on the other end of the line. After the initial programming, the code is no longer valid, and the only way to program the phone is via the MSL (master subsidy lock).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Name is the name of a file which resides in a handset's memory and contains a list of Sprint PCS and cellular network information. The PRL can assist the handset with acquisition of the Sprint PCS network and when a customer is roaming, the file directs the handset to acquire a signal from one of our roaming partners.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="25"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Update method is the method last used to download an AutoPRL. Possible Values: automatic manual OTAPA</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="automatic"/> <xs:enumeration value="manual"/> <xs:enumeration value="OTAPA"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreferredRoamingListUpdateUserType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Preferred Roaming List Update User is the user or the system that made the update.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="255"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaidFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PrePaidFlag indicates the Customer is required to pay for service in advance. Valid Value: true - Indicates the account is a pre-paid account. false â€“ Otherwise.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:boolean"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PrePaymentReasonTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre-Payment Reason Text is the reason for a pre-payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="200"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PreSharedKeyType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Pre Shared Key (PSK) is a shared secret which was previously shared between the two parties using some secure channel before it needs to be used. Such systems almost always use symmetric key cryptographic algorithms.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="32"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RetailStoreIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retail Store Identifer is the store ID passed from the retailer to inComm. These are 4 to 6 characters in length sometimes padded with zeros. Leading 0s should not be stripped off. (Examples: 001859, 1165, 0649)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="RevisionKeyStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Revision Key String is associated to the equipment type.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="6"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="StockKeepingUnitTypeCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Stock Keeping Unit represents the Sprint Inventory Stock Keeping Unit (SKU). Stock Keeping Unit identifies a group of PRODUCT instances. It could identify a handset Model and Model Number, a Kit or an accessory. Previously length = 18.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="10"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SubscriberIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Subscriber Identifier is a string that uniquely identifies a subscriber.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SystemIdentificationNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>System Identification Number (SID) which is assigned to identify a particular cellular carrier.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="5"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a uniqe identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UpdateFlagType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Update Flag is a boolean indicator of whether to update the associated data. true - update the associated data false - do not update the associated data</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:length value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="Y"/> <xs:enumeration value="N"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/validateDevicePair/v1/validateDevicePair.xsd" elementFormDefault="unqualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/validateDevicePair/v1/validateDevicePair.xsd"> <!--Date Author Change Rel SR#--> <!--2/21/2012 Steve Heichelheim 1.0 Added MVM standards and simple types GBL12.2 - PJ006784--> <xs:element name="validateDevicePair" type="tns:ValidateDevicePairRequestType"/> <xs:element name="validateDevicePairResponse" type="tns:ValidateDevicePairResponseType"/> <xs:complexType name="ValidateDevicePairRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceHexSerialNumber" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberHexType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hex format Required if deviceDecId is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceDecSerialNumber" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberDecType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ESN/Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format Required if deviceHexId is not provided</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="iccId" type="tns:UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique Integrated Circuit Card Identifier (ICCID) of the removable UICC</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidateDevicePairResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="message" type="tns:ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indication of success</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="ConfirmMessageTextType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confrim Message Text is a string with a confirmation message returned from the called API.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="99"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberDecType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Decimal is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in decimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="11"/> <xs:maxLength value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberHexType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number Hex is the value of a electronic serial number OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID) in hexidecimal format. This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UniversalIntegratedCircuitCardIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Universal Integrated Circuit Card Identifier is a unique identifier embedded in the smart card used in mobile terminals in CDMA, GSM and UMTS networks.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="20"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> </xs:schema>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/validateDeviceToken/v1/validateDeviceToken.xsd" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://integration.sprint.com/interfaces/validateDeviceToken/v1/validateDeviceToken.xsd"> <!--Date Changed By Version Change Description Release--> <!--04/30/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.0 initial version GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--04/30/2014 Adon Powell 1.0 simple types and standardization GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--05/13/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.1 - uiccImsi is removed from deviceInfo in the request, GBL14.2 PJ012352--> <!--- uiccImsi is added to the response to replace message--> <!--09/22/2014 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.2 Added activityType to the request GBL14.3.0 PJ012352 WC2 CR25--> <!--04/24/2015 Ibrahim ElKhatib 1.3 Changed DeviceSerialNumberType (element deviceId) maxLen restriction 20 to 64--> <!----> <xs:element name="validateDeviceToken" type="tns:ValidateDeviceTokenType"/> <xs:element name="validateDeviceTokenResponse" type="tns:ValidateDeviceTokenResponseType"/> <!----> <xs:complexType name="ValidateDeviceTokenType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceInfo" type="tns:DeviceInfoType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Structure containing the device related information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidateDeviceTokenResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="uiccImsi" type="tns:InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The IMSI of the LTE capable device for both embedded and removable UICC. The device LTE International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="DeviceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="deviceId" type="tns:DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The device unique identifier (MEID/ESN for primary device)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sipUserName" type="tns:UserNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) userName/IMS_PUBLIC_ID (IMPU) assigned to the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="deviceToken" type="tns:DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The websheet token to be authenticated to retrieve or update the Location Information for the device.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="activityType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>URL activity performed. Valid values: â€¢ maintainservice â€¢ activate â€¢ incompatibledevice â€¢ edit911address</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="30"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!----> <!--MVM/Shared Simple Types--> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceSerialNumberType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number is the value of a electronic serial number (ESN) OR Mobile Equipment Identifier(MEID). This type should be used when it is not known what type the serial number is.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation>Device Serial Number a unique number that is embedded electronically by the manufacturer into a wireless communication device that identifies that individual unit.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="64"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DeviceTokenKeyIdentifierType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Device Token Key Identifier is a unique idenifier assigned to a device and used for authentication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="InternationalMobileSubscriberIdentityStringType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) is a unique number associated with all GSM and Universal Mobile Telecommunications System (UMTS) network mobile phone users. It is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the phone and is sent by the phone to the network. It is also used to acquire other details of the mobile in the Home Location Register (HLR) or as locally copied in the Visitor Location Register. In order to avoid the subscriber being identified and tracked by eavesdroppers on the radio interface, the IMSI is sent as rarely as possible and a randomly generated TMSI is sent instead.
The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA and EVDO networks as well as GSM nets. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card (a CDMA analogue equivalent to a SIM card in GSM)
An IMSI is usually 15 digits long, but can be shorter (for example MTN South Africa's IMSIs are 14 digits). The first 3 digits are the Mobile Country Code (MCC), and is followed by the Mobile Network Code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard). The remaining digits are the Mobile Subscriber Identification Number (MSIN) within the network's customer base.
The IMSI conforms to the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) E.212 numbering standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="15"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UserNameType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>User Name is an identifier of the identity associated with a party role which is the public part of a paired identity assertion. User Name consists of all of the characters preceding the @ sign in a URL identifying a member of the specified Domain.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:maxLength value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <!----> <!--New Simple Types--> <!----> </xs:schema>
